item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Download and Execute Pattern

item.description: This rule detect common flag combinations used by CrackMapExec in order to detect its use even if the binary has been replaced.

item.description: Detects suspicious sub processes started by the ScreenConnect client service, which indicates the use of the so-called Backstage mode

item.description: Detects suspicious scheduled task creations from a parent stored in a temporary folder

item.description: Detects suspicious starts of explorer.exe that use the /NOUACCHECK flag that allows to run all sub processes of that newly started explorer.exe without any UAC checks

item.description: One way Qbot steals sensitive information is by extracting browser data from Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge by using the built-in utility esentutl.exe

item.title: Suspicious Redirection to Local Admin Share
item.description: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share as often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers

item.title: Dism Remove Online Package
item.description: Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. DISM is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

item.title: Suspicious Msiexec Execute Arbitrary DLL
item.description: Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads. Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

item.title: Suspicious Msiexec Quiet Install
item.description: Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads. Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

item.title: Obfuscated Command Line Using Special Unicode Characters
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit.

item.title: Run from a Zip File
item.description: Payloads may be compressed, archived, or encrypted in order to avoid detection

item.title: Rundll32 JS RunHTMLApplication Pattern
item.description: Detects suspicious command line patterns used when rundll32 is used to run JavaScript code

item.title: Uninstall Sysinternals Sysmon
item.description: Detects the uninstallation of Sysinternals Sysmon, which could be the result of legitimate administration or a manipulation for defense evasion

item.title: Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP IP Pattern

item.title: DevInit Lolbin Download
item.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by devinit.exe lolbin to download arbitrary MSI packages on a Windows system

item.title: Procdump Evasion
item.description: Detects uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility in which procdump or its output get renamed or a dump file is moved ot copied to a different name

item.title: Service ImagePath Change with Reg.exe
item.description: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services. Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start. Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services

item.title: Suspicious Kernel Dump Using Dtrace
item.description: Detects suspicious way to dump the kernel on Windows systems using dtrace.exe, which is available on Windows systems since Windows 10 19H1

item.title: Findstr GPP Passwords
item.description: Look for the encrypted cpassword value within Group Policy Preference files on the Domain Controller. This value can be decrypted with gpp-decrypt.

item.title: Password Cracking with Hashcat
item.description: Execute Hashcat.exe with provided SAM file from registry of Windows and Password list to crack against

item.title: Disable Important Scheduled Task
item.description: Adversaries may stop services or processes in order to conduct Data Destruction or Data Encrypted for Impact on the data stores of services like Exchange and SQL Server.

item.title: Overwrite Deleted Data with Cipher
item.description: Adversaries may destroy data and files on specific systems or in large numbers on a network to interrupt availability to systems, services, and network resources. Data destruction is likely to render stored data irrecoverable by forensic techniques through overwriting files or data on local and remote drives

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Taskkill
item.description: Adversaries may stop services or processes in order to conduct Data Destruction or Data Encrypted for Impact on the data stores of services like Exchange and SQL Server.

item.title: Abuse of Service Permissions to Hide Services in Tools

item.description: Threat actors can use the PsLogList utility to dump event log in order to extract admin accounts and perform account discovery.

item.title: Suspicious NT Resource Kit Auditpol Usage
item.description: Threat actors can use an older version of the auditpol binary available inside the NT resource kit to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability. This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.

item.title: CleanWipe Usage
item.description: Detects the use of CleanWipe a tool usually used to delete Symantec antivirus.

item.description: Detects the use of Advanced Port Scanner.

item.title: Suspicious Where Execution
item.description: Adversaries may enumerate browser bookmarks to learn more about compromised hosts. Browser bookmarks may reveal personal information about users (ex: banking sites, interests, social media, etc.) as well as details about internal network resources such as servers, tools/dashboards, or other related infrastructure.

item.title: Suspicious Get Local Groups Information with WMIC
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to find local system groups and permission settings. The knowledge of local system permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group. Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as the users found within the local administrators group.

item.title: Change Default File Association
item.description: When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

item.title: Abusing Windows Telemetry For Persistence
item.description: Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections. This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run. The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.

item.title: Detecting Fake Instances Of Hxtsr.exe
item.description: HxTsr.exe is a Microsoft compressed executable file called Microsoft Outlook Communications.HxTsr.exe is part of Outlook apps, because it resides in a hidden “WindowsApps” subfolder of “C:\Program Files”. Its path includes a version number, e.g., “C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\microsoft.windowscommunicationsapps_17.7466.41167.0_x64__8wekyb3d8bbwe\HxTsr.exe”. Any instances of hxtsr.exe not in this folder may be malware camouflaging itself as HxTsr.exe

item.title: Detection of PowerShell Execution via Sqlps.exe
item.description: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

item.title: Impacket Lateralization Detection
item.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

item.title: Imports Registry Key From a File
item.description: Detects the import of the specified file to the registry with regedit.exe.

item.title: Imports Registry Key From an ADS
item.description: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.

item.title: Indirect Command Execution By Program Compatibility Wizard
item.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcwrun.exe

item.title: InfDefaultInstall.exe .inf Execution
item.description: Executes SCT script using scrobj.dll from a command in entered into a specially prepared INF file.

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher
item.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher
item.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher
item.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts

item.title: Lazarus Session Highjacker
item.description: Detects executables launched outside their default directories as used by Lazarus Group (Bluenoroff)

item.title: LockerGoga Ransomware
item.description: Detects LockerGoga Ransomware command line.

item.title: Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger
item.description: There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger “vsjitdebugger.exe” to launch specified executable and attach a debugger. This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary. The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.

item.title: Malicious Windows Script Components File Execution by TAEF Detection
item.description: Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces). Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe

item.title: Mimikatz Command Line
item.description: Detection well-known mimikatz command line arguments

item.title: MMC20 Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of “-Embedding” as a child of svchost.exe

item.title: Modification Of Existing Services For Persistence
item.description: Detects modification of an existing service on a compromised host in order to execute an arbitrary payload when the service is started or killed as a method of persistence.

item.title: Modifies the Registry From a ADS
item.description: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.

item.title: Modifies the Registry From a File
item.description: Detects the execution of regini.exe which can be used to modify registry keys, the changes are imported from one or more text files.

item.title: Monitoring For Persistence Via BITS
item.description: BITS will allow you to schedule a command to execute after a successful download to notify you that the job is finished. When the job runs on the system the command specified in the BITS job will be executed. This can be abused by actors to create a backdoor within the system and for persistence. It will be chained in a BITS job to schedule the download of malware/additional binaries and execute the program after being downloaded

item.title: Monitoring Winget For LOLbin Execution
item.description: Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them without touching disk. Winget will be included by default in Windows 10 and is already available in Windows 10 insider programs. The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client. Winget can be used to download and install exe’s, msi, msix files later.

item.title: Monitoring Wuauclt.exe For Lolbas Execution Of DLL
item.description: Adversaries can abuse wuauclt.exe (Windows Update client) to run code execution by specifying an arbitrary DLL.

item.title: Mounted Share Deleted
item.description: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation

item.title: Mounted Windows Admin Shares with net.exe
item.description: Detects when an admin share is mounted using net.exe

item.title: MS Office Product Spawning Exe in User Dir
item.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher or Visio

item.title: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation
item.description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent

item.title: Mshta Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a mshta.exe process

item.title: Netsh Allow Group Policy on Microsoft Defender Firewall
item.description: Adversaries may modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage

item.title: Netsh Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding (PortProxy)

item.title: Netsh Port or Application Allowed
item.description: Allow Incoming Connections by Port or Application on Windows Firewall

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding of port 3389 used for RDP

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Opening
item.description: Detects netsh commands that opens the port 3389 used for RDP, used in Sarwent Malware

item.title: Network Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects a set of suspicious network related commands often used in recon stages

item.title: Ngrok Usage
item.description: Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available. Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.

item.title: Non-privileged Usage of Reg or Powershell
item.description: Search for usage of reg or Powershell by non-priveleged users to modify service configuration in registry

item.title: Password Provided In Command Line Of Net.exe
item.description: Detects a when net.exe is called with a password in the command line

item.title: Pingback Backdoor
item.description: Detects the use of Pingback backdoor that creates ICMP tunnel for C2 as described in the trustwave report

item.title: Possible Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Modifications
item.description: Detects, possibly, malicious unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

item.title: Possible SPN Enumeration
item.description: Detects Service Principal Name Enumeration used for Kerberoasting

item.title: Powershell Defender Base64 MpPreference
item.description: Detects base64 encoded PowerShell code that modifies Windows Defender

item.title: Powershell Defender Disable Scan Feature
item.description: Detects requests to disable Microsoft Defender features using PowerShell commands

item.title: Powershell Defender Exclusion
item.description: Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets

item.title: PowerShell Encoded Character Syntax
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

item.title: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS
item.description: Detects a Get-Process command on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity

item.title: Powershell Reverse Shell Connection
item.description: Detects the Nishang Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine reverse shell

item.title: Powershell Used To Disable Windows Defender AV Security Monitoring
item.description: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell

item.title: Process Dump via Comsvcs DLL
item.description: Detects process memory dump via comsvcs.dll and rundll32

item.title: Proxy Execution Via Explorer.exe
item.description: Attackers can use explorer.exe for evading defense mechanisms

item.title: PsExec/PAExec Flags
item.description: Detects suspicious flags used by PsExec and PAExec but no usual program name in command line

item.title: PurpleSharp Indicator
item.description: Detects the execution of the PurpleSharp adversary simulation tool

item.title: QBot Process Creation
item.description: Detects QBot like process executions

item.title: Raccine Uninstall
item.description: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.

item.title: Rar with Password or Compression Level
item.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.

item.title: RdrLeakDiag Process Dump
item.description: Detects uses of the rdrleakdiag.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory

item.title: Recon Activity with NLTEST
item.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: Reg Add RUN Key
item.description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

item.title: Regedit as Trusted Installer
item.description: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe

item.title: Registry Dump of SAM Creds and Secrets
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to extract credential material from the Security Account Manager (SAM) database either through Windows Registry where the SAM database is stored

item.title: Registry Parse with Pypykatz
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to extract credential material from the Security Account Manager (SAM) database either through Windows Registry where the SAM database is stored

item.title: Remote Code Execute via Winrm.vbs
item.description: Detects an attempt to execute code or create service on remote host via winrm.vbs.

item.title: Remote Desktop Protocol Use Mstsc
item.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

item.title: Remove Windows Defender Definition Files
item.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by removing Windows Defender Definition Files

item.title: Renamed jusched.exe
item.description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group

item.title: Renamed MegaSync
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed meg.exe of MegaSync during incident response engagements associated with ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.

item.title: Renamed PAExec
item.description: Detects suspicious renamed PAExec execution as often used by attackers

item.title: Renamed SysInternals Debug View
item.description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution

item.title: REvil Kaseya Incident Malware Patterns
item.description: Detects process command line patterns and locations used by REvil group in Kaseya incident (can also match on other malware)

item.title: Run Once Task Execution as Configured in Registry
item.description: This rule detects the execution of Run Once task as configured in the registry

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from ADS
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect

item.title: Run Whoami as SYSTEM
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed by LOCAL SYSTEM. This may be a sign of a successful local privilege escalation.

item.title: Run Whoami Showing Privileges
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privieleges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.

item.title: Rundll32 Without Parameters
item.description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module

item.title: Ryuk Ransomware
item.description: Detects Ryuk Ransomware command lines

item.title: Scheduled Task WScript VBScript
item.description: Detects specific process parameters as used by ACTINIUM scheduled task persistence creation.

item.title: ScreenConnect Remote Access
item.description: Detects ScreenConnect program starts that establish a remote access to that system (not meeting, not remote support)

item.title: Script Event Consumer Spawning Process
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).

item.title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious script executions in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables

item.title: Sdclt Child Processes
item.description: A General detection for sdclt spawning new processes. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.

item.title: Set Windows System File with Attrib
item.description: Marks a file as a system file using the attrib.exe utility

item.title: Shadow Copies Access via Symlink
item.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

item.title: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

item.title: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities

item.title: ShimCache Flush
item.description: Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence

item.title: SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection
item.description: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

item.title: Squirrel Lolbin
item.description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin

item.title: Stop Or Remove Antivirus Service
item.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by stopping antivirus service

item.title: Suspicious Add Scheduled Task From User AppData Temp
item.description: schtasks.exe create task from user AppData\Local\Temp

item.title: Suspicious Add User to Remote Desktop Users Group
item.description: Detects suspicious command line in which a user gets added to the local Remote Desktop Users group

item.title: Suspicious Atbroker Execution
item.description: Atbroker executing non-deafualt Assistive Technology applications

item.title: Suspicious Auditpol Usage
item.description: Threat actors can use auditpol binary to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability. This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.

item.title: Suspicious Calculator Usage
item.description: Detects suspicious use of calc.exe with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion

item.title: Suspicious Copy From or To System32
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command that copies a system program from System32 to another directory on disk - sometimes used to use LOLBINs like certutil or desktopimgdownldr to a different location with a different name

item.title: Suspicious Curl File Upload
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

item.title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

item.title: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
item.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious Eventlog Clear or Configuration Using Wevtutil
item.description: Detects clearing or configuration of eventlogs using wevtutil, powershell and wmic. Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others).

item.title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook
item.description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Adidnsdump
item.description: This tool enables enumeration and exporting of all DNS records in the zone for recon purposes of internal networks Python 3 and python.exe must be installed, Usee to Query/modify DNS records for Active Directory integrated DNS via LDAP

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Hostname
item.description: Use of hostname to get information

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
item.description: Commandline to lauch powershell with a base64 payload

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Shutdown
item.description: Use of the commandline to shutdown or reboot windows

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Systeminfo
item.description: Use of systeminfo to get information

item.title: Suspicious ftp.exe
item.description: Detects renamed ftp.exe, ftp.exe script execution and child processes ran by ftp.exe

item.title: Suspicious GUP Usage
item.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks

item.title: Suspicious LOLBIN AccCheckConsole
item.description: Detects suspicious LOLBIN AccCheckConsole execution with parameters as used to load an arbitrary DLL

item.title: Suspicious Netsh Discovery Command
item.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

item.title: Suspicious Network Command
item.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

item.title: Suspicious Ntdll Pipe Redirection
item.description: Detects command that type the content of ntdll.dll to a different file or a pipe in order to evade AV / EDR detection

item.title: Suspicious OfflineScannerShell.exe Execution From Another Folder
item.description: Use OfflineScannerShell.exe to execute mpclient.dll library in the current working directory

item.title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe
item.description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery

item.title: Suspicious Plink Remote Forwarding
item.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel remote forarding to a local port

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Cmdline
item.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with reversed strings

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share
item.description: Detects a PowerShell New-MailboxExportRequest that exports a mailbox to a local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious Query of MachineGUID
item.description: Use of reg to get MachineGuid information

item.title: Suspicious Registration via cscript.exe
item.description: Detects when the registration of a VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application.

item.title: Suspicious Replace.exe Execution
item.description: Replace.exe is used to replace file with another file

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity Invoking Sys File
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Invoking Inline VBScript
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that invokes inline VBScript as seen being used by UNC2452

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Script in CommandLine
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on arguments

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Setupapi.dll Activity
item.description: setupapi.dll library provide InstallHinfSection function for processing INF files. INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Without Any CommandLine Params
item.description: Detects suspicious start of rundll32.exe without any parameters as found in CobaltStrike beacon activity

item.title: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe
item.description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe

item.title: Suspicious Sc Query
item.description: Adversaries may try to get information about registered services

item.title: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once

item.title: Suspicious Service Binary Directory
item.description: Detects a service binary running in a suspicious directory

item.title: Suspicious Service DACL Modification
item.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable

item.title: Suspicious Shells Spawn by WinRM
item.description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from WinRM host process

item.title: Suspicious UltraVNC Execution
item.description: Detects suspicious UltraVNC command line flag combination that indicate a auto reconnect upon execution, e.g. startup (as seen being used by Gamaredon threat group)

item.title: Suspicious Usage of the Manage-bde.wsf Script
item.description: Detects a usage of the manage-bde.wsf script that may indicate an attempt of proxy execution from script

item.title: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
item.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

item.title: Suspicious VBoxDrvInst.exe Parameters
item.description: Detect VBoxDrvInst.exe run with parameters allowing processing INF file. This allows to create values in the registry and install drivers. For example one could use this technique to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys

item.title: Suspicious VBScript UN2452 Pattern
item.description: Detects suspicious inline VBScript keywords as used by UNC2452

item.title: Suspicious WebDav Client Execution
item.description: A General detection for svchost.exe spawning rundll32.exe with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server).

item.title: Suspicious WMI Reconnaissance
item.description: An adversary might use WMI to list Processes running on the compromised host or list installed Software hotfix and patches.

item.title: Suspicious WMIC ActiveScriptEventConsumer Creation
item.description: Detects WMIC executions in which a event consumer gets created in order to establish persistence

item.title: Suspicious ZipExec Execution
item.description: ZipExec is a Proof-of-Concept (POC) tool to wrap binary-based tools into a password-protected zip file.

item.title: Sysinternals SDelete Delete File
item.description: Use of SDelete to erase a file not the free space

item.title: TA505 Dropper Load Pattern
item.description: Detects mshta loaded by wmiprvse as parent as used by TA505 malicious documents

item.title: TAIDOOR RAT DLL Load
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Chinese TAIDOOR RAT malware load

item.title: TropicTrooper Campaign November 2018
item.description: Detects TropicTrooper activity, an actor who targeted high-profile organizations in the energy and food and beverage sectors in Asia

item.title: Turla Group Commands May 2020
item.description: Detects commands used by Turla group as reported by ESET in May 2020

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group

item.title: UNC2452 PowerShell Pattern
item.description: Detects a specific PowerShell command line pattern used by the UNC2452 actors as mentioned in Microsoft and Symantec reports

item.title: UNC2452 Process Creation Patterns
item.description: Detects a specific process creation patterns as seen used by UNC2452 and provided by Microsoft as Microsoft Defender ATP queries

item.title: Unidentified Attacker November 2018
item.description: A sigma rule detecting an unidetefied attacker who used phishing emails to target high profile orgs on November 2018. The Actor shares some TTPs with YYTRIUM/APT29 campaign in 2016.

item.title: Uninstall Crowdstrike Falcon
item.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by uninstalling Crowdstrike Falcon

item.title: Using SettingSyncHost.exe as LOLBin
item.description: Detects using SettingSyncHost.exe to run hijacked binary

item.title: Using Sticky-keys To Obtain Unauthenticated, Privileged Console Access
item.description: By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system. When the sticky keys are “activated” the privilleged shell is launched.

item.title: Verclsid.exe Runs COM Object
item.description: Detects when verclsid.exe is used to run COM object via GUID

item.title: Visual Basic Command Line Compiler Usage
item.description: Detects successful code compilation via Visual Basic Command Line Compiler that utilizes Windows Resource to Object Converter.

item.title: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process
item.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup

item.title: Windows Update Client LOLBIN
item.description: Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)

item.title: Winnti Malware HK University Campaign
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Winnti malware noticed in Dec/Jan 2020 in a campaign against Honk Kong universities

item.title: WinRM Access with Evil-WinRM
item.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

item.title: Winword.exe Loads Suspicious DLL
item.description: Detects Winword.exe loading of custmom dll via /l cmd switch

item.title: WMI Reconnaissance List Remote Services
item.description: An adversary might use WMI to check if a certain Remote Service is running on a remote device. When the test completes, a service information will be displayed on the screen if it exists. A common feedback message is that “No instance(s) Available” if the service queried is not running. A common error message is “Node - (provided IP or default) ERROR Description =The RPC server is unavailable” if the provided remote host is unreacheable

item.title: WMI Spawning Windows PowerShell
item.description: Detects WMI spawning PowerShell

item.title: Wmic Uninstall Security Product
item.description: Detects deinstallation of security products using WMIC utility

item.title: WMIExec VBS Script
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript

item.title: Write Protect For Storage Disabled
item.description: Looks for changes to registry to disable any write-protect property for storage devices. This could be a precursor to a ransomware attack and has been an observed technique used by cypherpunk group.

item.title: Writing Of Malicious Files To The Fonts Folder
item.description: Monitors for the hiding possible malicious files in the C:\Windows\Fonts\ location. This folder doesn’t require admin privillege to be written and executed from.

item.title: WSL Execution
item.description: Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN
